line_1: To compass an ambitious end,
line_2: He acts the persecuting Fiend;

line_1: He acts the persecuting Fiend;
line_2: To compass an ambitious end,

line_1: That never gave one real joy,
line_2: Which all his happiness annoy:

line_1: Which all his happiness annoy:
line_2: That never gave one real joy,

line_1: When fierce ambition cruel reigns,
line_2: Nor dove-like pity's melting strains.

line_1: Nor dove-like pity's melting strains.
line_2: When fierce ambition cruel reigns,

line_1: He seeks the Wretch his soul disproves;
line_2: E'en immolates the Child he loves.

line_1: E'en immolates the Child he loves.
line_2: He seeks the Wretch his soul disproves;

line_1: Will Man but by experience learn?
line_2: His real interest to discern?

line_1: His real interest to discern?
line_2: Will Man but by experience learn?

line_1: The Ills which from ambition flow,
line_2: Is Folly, Vanity, and Woe.

line_1: Is Folly, Vanity, and Woe.
line_2: The Ills which from ambition flow,

line_1: Which blindfold he is doom'd to tread,
line_2: And tempts the danger he should dread.

line_1: And tempts the danger he should dread.
line_2: Which blindfold he is doom'd to tread,

line_1: Reason and Prudence quit their post;
line_2: Unshipp'd its helm, its compass lost.

line_1: Unshipp'd its helm, its compass lost.
line_2: Reason and Prudence quit their post;

line_1: Point out the course it ought to steer;
line_2: Till Fate allows no time to veer.

line_1: Till Fate allows no time to veer.
line_2: Point out the course it ought to steer;

line_1: (Oh! may her warning voice prevail!)
line_2: Her moral pointing, from a tale.

line_1: Her moral pointing, from a tale.
line_2: (Oh! may her warning voice prevail!)

line_1: Dark gathering clouds deform'd the East;
line_2: Nor saw, nor hop'd a place of rest.

line_1: Nor saw, nor hop'd a place of rest.
line_2: Dark gathering clouds deform'd the East;

line_1: Frore snow and beating hail descend;
line_2: His weary way-worn steps to bend.

line_1: His weary way-worn steps to bend.
line_2: Frore snow and beating hail descend;

line_1: Fatigued, benumb'd with piercing cold;
line_2: A not far distant bell was toll'd.

line_1: A not far distant bell was toll'd.
line_2: Fatigued, benumb'd with piercing cold;

line_1: Hush'd were his sorrows and his fears;
line_2: His quicken'd, onward course he steers.

line_1: His quicken'd, onward course he steers.
line_2: Hush'd were his sorrows and his fears;

line_1: Proclaim'd the solemn hour of night:
line_2: And sees a spreading, glaring light.

line_1: And sees a spreading, glaring light.
line_2: Proclaim'd the solemn hour of night:

line_1: To meet its dazzling, welcome rays;
line_2: A cloister'd convent's dome, displays.

line_1: A cloister'd convent's dome, displays.
line_2: To meet its dazzling, welcome rays;

line_1: To shroud his tempest-beaten head:
line_2: Whilst midnight Mass within was said.

line_1: Whilst midnight Mass within was said.
line_2: To shroud his tempest-beaten head:

line_1: Cheers his just fainting, woe-struck heart;
line_2: Which from his half-clos'd eyelids start:

line_1: Which from his half-clos'd eyelids start:
line_2: Cheers his just fainting, woe-struck heart;

line_1: On the smooth brow of this lov'd sage
line_2: Yields to the majesty of Age.

line_1: Yields to the majesty of Age.
line_2: On the smooth brow of this lov'd sage

line_1: Why at this hour thou kneelest here?
line_2: That heart-heav'd sigh, that falling tear?

line_1: That heart-heav'd sigh, that falling tear?
line_2: Why at this hour thou kneelest here?

line_1: Thy rugged poverty declare:
line_2: Then haste my happy Cell to share.

line_1: Then haste my happy Cell to share.
line_2: Thy rugged poverty declare:

line_1: The hapless way-spent Pilgrim sigh'd;
line_2: No Thanks, the priestly Saint reply'd.

line_1: No Thanks, the priestly Saint reply'd.
line_2: The hapless way-spent Pilgrim sigh'd;

line_1: The child of want, and woe, his care;
line_2: Thou hast a Brother's rightful share.

line_1: Thou hast a Brother's rightful share.
line_2: The child of want, and woe, his care;

line_1: What I with heartfelt pleasure give;
line_2: The helpless would from thee receive.

line_1: The helpless would from thee receive.
line_2: What I with heartfelt pleasure give;

line_1: Some deep-felt hopeless grief disclose;
line_2: But can'st not heal my mental woes."

line_1: But can'st not heal my mental woes."
line_2: Some deep-felt hopeless grief disclose;

line_1: Might cheat an undiscerning eye; —
line_2: The blushing Guest made no reply.

line_1: The blushing Guest made no reply.
line_2: Might cheat an undiscerning eye; —

line_1: For young, my Son! I see thou art,
line_2: Yet would I ease thy troubled heart.

line_1: Yet would I ease thy troubled heart.
line_2: For young, my Son! I see thou art,

line_1: Glows nobly on thy downcast face;
line_2: With simple, native, manly, grace.

line_1: With simple, native, manly, grace.
line_2: Glows nobly on thy downcast face;

line_1: Must my respect and pity move;
line_2: It claims a Father's care, and love.

line_1: It claims a Father's care, and love.
line_2: Must my respect and pity move;

line_1: Do aught for thee beyond this hour?
line_2: Tell! freely tax my utmost power.

line_1: Tell! freely tax my utmost power.
line_2: Do aught for thee beyond this hour?

line_1: Not circumscrib'd is Hubert's heart;
line_2: Thy wants, within its reach, impart.

line_1: Thy wants, within its reach, impart.
line_2: Not circumscrib'd is Hubert's heart;

line_1: Art thou that Sainted Hubert, say!
line_2: To give his holy doctrines sway?

line_1: To give his holy doctrines sway?
line_2: Art thou that Sainted Hubert, say!

line_1: A Mitre's gorgeous envy'd load?
line_2: And honour's courted, thorn-strow'd road?

line_1: And honour's courted, thorn-strow'd road?
line_2: A Mitre's gorgeous envy'd load?

line_1: Enough, — the heart-sad Pilgrim cried, —
line_2: Friend of the wretch! the wand'rer's guide:

line_1: Friend of the wretch! the wand'rer's guide:
line_2: Enough, — the heart-sad Pilgrim cried, —

line_1: Father! let me thy blessing share;
line_2: God will look down, and hear thy prayer.

line_1: God will look down, and hear thy prayer.
line_2: Father! let me thy blessing share;

line_1: May Heaven, the pious Hubert said,
line_2: And shower its bounties on thy head.

line_1: And shower its bounties on thy head.
line_2: May Heaven, the pious Hubert said,

line_1: And sure Heaven pointed out the way,
line_2: Far from my destin'd course astray.

line_1: Far from my destin'd course astray.
line_2: And sure Heaven pointed out the way,

line_1: My inmost thoughts, I dare disclose;
line_2: And all my bitter unearn'd woes.

line_1: And all my bitter unearn'd woes.
line_2: My inmost thoughts, I dare disclose;

line_1: These weeds are not my birth-right's dress.
line_2: But dash'd, untouch'd, my cup of bliss.

line_1: But dash'd, untouch'd, my cup of bliss.
line_2: These weeds are not my birth-right's dress.

line_1: Some dire, some unknown stroke I dread.
line_2: The hand of Heaven against this head.

line_1: The hand of Heaven against this head.
line_2: Some dire, some unknown stroke I dread.

line_1: The shaken, bruised, broken reed.
line_2: Must I, Eternal Justice! bleed?

line_1: Must I, Eternal Justice! bleed?
line_2: The shaken, bruised, broken reed.

line_1: My harrass'd heart foreboding shows —
line_2: Before my fatal last of woes.

line_1: Before my fatal last of woes.
line_2: My harrass'd heart foreboding shows —

line_1: This causeless, sick'ning horrour knew;
line_2: Her fatal, tender, last Adieu.

line_1: Her fatal, tender, last Adieu.
line_2: This causeless, sick'ning horrour knew;

line_1: "Henry renounce, forgive, resign —
line_2: "For I must never, now, be thine,

line_1: "For I must never, now, be thine,
line_2: "Henry renounce, forgive, resign —

line_1: " But not from thee, my heart is torn.
line_2: " Thy wretched friend, shall ever mourn. "

line_1: " Thy wretched friend, shall ever mourn. "
line_2: " But not from thee, my heart is torn.

line_1: 'T was strong compulsion urg'd the deed, —
line_2: Why didst thou doom my heart to bleed?

line_1: Why didst thou doom my heart to bleed?
line_2: 'T was strong compulsion urg'd the deed, —

line_1: Forc'd us to curse our hapless fate.
line_2: Thy Daughter made a Wretch in state? —

line_1: Thy Daughter made a Wretch in state? —
line_2: Forc'd us to curse our hapless fate.

line_1: Thou art her Sire — I curse thee not —
line_2: And mourn with useless grief my lot. —

line_1: And mourn with useless grief my lot. —
line_2: Thou art her Sire — I curse thee not —

line_1: Whose mind surpass'd her far-fam'd charms.
line_2: Yet tore her from these faithful arms.

line_1: Yet tore her from these faithful arms.
line_2: Whose mind surpass'd her far-fam'd charms.

line_1: The sun ne'er rose to gild my Day;
line_2: Or radiant shed his parting ray.

line_1: Or radiant shed his parting ray.
line_2: The sun ne'er rose to gild my Day;

line_1: Was what I could not bear to see.
line_2: Has never lov'd, nor felt, like me.

line_1: Has never lov'd, nor felt, like me.
line_2: Was what I could not bear to see.

line_1: Nor stay'd till they had seal'd my doom:
line_2: And sought La Trappe's impervious gloom.

line_1: And sought La Trappe's impervious gloom.
line_2: Nor stay'd till they had seal'd my doom:

line_1: A faithless World, not worth its care;
line_2: Not from Religion, but despair.

line_1: Not from Religion, but despair.
line_2: A faithless World, not worth its care;

line_1: Perjur'd I am, e'en at Heaven's Shrine,
line_2: And ne'er again the world to join.

line_1: And ne'er again the world to join.
line_2: Perjur'd I am, e'en at Heaven's Shrine,

line_1: Have tempted me to break those Vows.
line_2: And pardon what it disallows? —

line_1: And pardon what it disallows? —
line_2: Have tempted me to break those Vows.

line_1: Of Life's incumbent, hated load;
line_2: With nought conversing, but my God:

line_1: With nought conversing, but my God:
line_2: Of Life's incumbent, hated load;

line_1: With gloomy pleasure I've observ'd:
line_2: From silence, ne'er till now I've swerv'd.

line_1: From silence, ne'er till now I've swerv'd.
line_2: With gloomy pleasure I've observ'd:

line_1: Which brings my guilty footsteps here,
line_2: Expiring press'd the welcome bier!

line_1: Expiring press'd the welcome bier!
line_2: Which brings my guilty footsteps here,

line_1: Been to my slow-made grave consign'd;
line_2: As in my requiem they had join'd.

line_1: As in my requiem they had join'd.
line_2: Been to my slow-made grave consign'd;

line_1: My hope — my wish — my peace — my gain! —
line_2: Quick snatch me to thy dark domain. —

line_1: Quick snatch me to thy dark domain. —
line_2: My hope — my wish — my peace — my gain! —

line_1: Aghast he fix'd his eager eyes,
line_2: And, frantic thus to Hubert cries.

line_1: And, frantic thus to Hubert cries.
line_2: Aghast he fix'd his eager eyes,

line_1: Mark what her trembling lips shall say! —
line_2: See! see! she slowly melts away.

line_1: See! see! she slowly melts away.
line_2: Mark what her trembling lips shall say! —

line_1: Oh! keep that charming, lovely form!
line_2: To feed the loathsome, bloated worm.

line_1: To feed the loathsome, bloated worm.
line_2: Oh! keep that charming, lovely form!

line_1: As erst beside my slow-dug grave.
line_2: Or what thy dreadful Visits crave!

line_1: Or what thy dreadful Visits crave!
line_2: As erst beside my slow-dug grave.

line_1: As thy own spotless, heavenly mind?
line_2: Glow'd in this breast, where thou art shrin'd.

line_1: Glow'd in this breast, where thou art shrin'd.
line_2: As thy own spotless, heavenly mind?

line_1: To search, why thou disturb'st my rest.
line_2: Within thy Henry's faithful breast?

line_1: Within thy Henry's faithful breast?
line_2: To search, why thou disturb'st my rest.

line_1: Make me thy only chosen aid?
line_2: Protect thee if thou art betray'd.

line_1: Protect thee if thou art betray'd.
line_2: Make me thy only chosen aid?

line_1: Say why thou nightly thus art seen?
line_2: Or what thy fearful Visits mean! —

line_1: Or what thy fearful Visits mean! —
line_2: Say why thou nightly thus art seen?

line_1: Rise in thy beauty to my sight.
line_2: Her radiant robe of living light.

line_1: Her radiant robe of living light.
line_2: Rise in thy beauty to my sight.

line_1: O shield me from this horrid sight!
line_2: And shroud each sense in dunnest night.

line_1: And shroud each sense in dunnest night.
line_2: O shield me from this horrid sight!

line_1: Thy form thus mould'ring to decay?
line_2: Terrific vision! lead the way! —

line_1: Terrific vision! lead the way! —
line_2: Thy form thus mould'ring to decay?

line_1: The pious Hubert rais'd his head;
line_2: Whilst o'er his woes, his bosom bled.

line_1: Whilst o'er his woes, his bosom bled.
line_2: The pious Hubert rais'd his head;

line_1: Blest is that man who patient bears,
line_2: Affliction, in this vale of tears.

line_1: Affliction, in this vale of tears.
line_2: Blest is that man who patient bears,

line_1: Say, cries the youth, hast thou a charm
line_2: My memory of its sting disarm?

line_1: My memory of its sting disarm?
line_2: Say, cries the youth, hast thou a charm

line_1: All other aid but that were vain.
line_2: Or strive the raging winds, to chain?

line_1: Or strive the raging winds, to chain?
line_2: All other aid but that were vain.

line_1: Has lawless rul'd, without control?
line_2: This blackest tempest, of the Soul?

line_1: This blackest tempest, of the Soul?
line_2: Has lawless rul'd, without control?

line_1: Within art's ample, healing bound?
line_2: A scorpion's venom to my wound.

line_1: A scorpion's venom to my wound.
line_2: Within art's ample, healing bound?

line_1: No converse with the world's allow'd;
line_2: To whom my early faith was vow'd.

line_1: To whom my early faith was vow'd.
line_2: No converse with the world's allow'd;

line_1: Nor more with visions be oppress'd.
line_2: And patient wait eternal rest.

line_1: And patient wait eternal rest.
line_2: Nor more with visions be oppress'd.

line_1: Full many a league I've yet to stray;
line_2: As to La Trappe I steer'd my way.

line_1: As to La Trappe I steer'd my way.
line_2: Full many a league I've yet to stray;

line_1: I'll view, unseen, the form I love:
line_2: And from my soul this load remove.

line_1: And from my soul this load remove.
line_2: I'll view, unseen, the form I love:

line_1: O, dread the dangers of the way!
line_2: Thy wildness will thy crime betray.

line_1: Thy wildness will thy crime betray.
line_2: O, dread the dangers of the way!

line_1: Ne'er but with life, the Youth reply'd;
line_2: Then, Parent Earth! my sorrows hide!

line_1: Then, Parent Earth! my sorrows hide!
line_2: Ne'er but with life, the Youth reply'd;

line_1: What can avail thy feeble age
line_2: Nerv'd by athletic, frantic rage?

line_1: Nerv'd by athletic, frantic rage?
line_2: What can avail thy feeble age

line_1: O venerable Sire! forbear —
line_2: Dread to contend with fix'd despair —

line_1: Dread to contend with fix'd despair —
line_2: O venerable Sire! forbear —

line_1: I venerate thy hoary hairs,
line_2: Nor e'en thy trembling, starting tears,

line_1: Nor e'en thy trembling, starting tears,
line_2: I venerate thy hoary hairs,

line_1: No Lion's force; not temper'd steel
line_2: Forgive the guilt thou ne'er canst feel!

line_1: Forgive the guilt thou ne'er canst feel!
line_2: No Lion's force; not temper'd steel

line_1: No longer shall my arm contend:
line_2: But hear the counsel of a friend.

line_1: But hear the counsel of a friend.
line_2: No longer shall my arm contend:

line_1: Instruct me what I ought to do;
line_2: Yet keep my Duty still in view!

line_1: Yet keep my Duty still in view!
line_2: Instruct me what I ought to do;

line_1: Thy secret trusted to my breast,
line_2: Whilst thought and memory shall rest.

line_1: Whilst thought and memory shall rest.
line_2: Thy secret trusted to my breast,

line_1: Be rul'd, and in thy friend confide;
line_2: Thy wandering mind, thy footsteps guide.

line_1: Thy wandering mind, thy footsteps guide.
line_2: Be rul'd, and in thy friend confide;

line_1: An awful Rite demands my care.
line_2: Claim, in that Sacrifice, thy share.

line_1: Claim, in that Sacrifice, thy share.
line_2: An awful Rite demands my care.

line_1: The form thou ought'st not now to love,
line_2: My offer'd aid thou wilt approve.

line_1: My offer'd aid thou wilt approve.
line_2: The form thou ought'st not now to love,

line_1: Prescrib'd, protecting thee, I go;
line_2: And stem, not aid, the storm of woe.

line_1: And stem, not aid, the storm of woe.
line_2: Prescrib'd, protecting thee, I go;

line_1: Yet better, Son! thy plan delay.
line_2: And to La Trappe retrace thy way?

line_1: And to La Trappe retrace thy way?
line_2: Yet better, Son! thy plan delay.

line_1: A Prophet's eloquence would fail,
line_2: Nor Heaven's fear'd wrath could aught avail.

line_1: Nor Heaven's fear'd wrath could aught avail.
line_2: A Prophet's eloquence would fail,

line_1: Bid the fix'd stars in orbits roll;
line_2: And hurl them foaming to the Pole.

line_1: And hurl them foaming to the Pole.
line_2: Bid the fix'd stars in orbits roll;

line_1: The stricken Mind of freeborn Man,
line_2: Though all unequal, has its plan.

line_1: Though all unequal, has its plan.
line_2: The stricken Mind of freeborn Man,

line_1: Too near approaches to that height,
line_2: And joins with madness in her flight.

line_1: And joins with madness in her flight.
line_2: Too near approaches to that height,

line_1: Father! I never will return;
line_2: Or clasp'd these arms around her Urn.

line_1: Or clasp'd these arms around her Urn.
line_2: Father! I never will return;

line_1: I dare in Hubert's promise trust:
line_2: Vouch, that thou canst not be unjust.

line_1: Vouch, that thou canst not be unjust.
line_2: I dare in Hubert's promise trust:

line_1: Thy welcome presence shall supply
line_2: As His, I'll fear thy piercing Eye.

line_1: As His, I'll fear thy piercing Eye.
line_2: Thy welcome presence shall supply

line_1: It errs from woe, not wilful Sin:
line_2: And aid the monitor within.

line_1: And aid the monitor within.
line_2: It errs from woe, not wilful Sin:

line_1: Be the companion of my way:
line_2: To prayer. Let me its voice obey.

line_1: To prayer. Let me its voice obey.
line_2: Be the companion of my way:

line_1: " Omniscient, all-pervading mind!
line_2: " Look from that Heaven, where thou art shrin'd.

line_1: " Look from that Heaven, where thou art shrin'd.
line_2: " Omniscient, all-pervading mind!

line_1: " Thy Sword of Justice rais'd on high;
line_2: " Thee, let my trembling soul, descry.

line_1: " Thee, let my trembling soul, descry.
line_2: " Thy Sword of Justice rais'd on high;

line_1: " Wert thou but terrible and just;
line_2: " But thou art Mercy, — I am dust.

line_1: " But thou art Mercy, — I am dust.
line_2: " Wert thou but terrible and just;

line_1: " Forlorn of thee for ends divine.
line_2: " And be the praise, and Glory, thine. —

line_1: " And be the praise, and Glory, thine. —
line_2: " Forlorn of thee for ends divine.

line_1: " Meek let me bow before thy rod,
line_2: " Nor dare to murmur at my God!

line_1: " Nor dare to murmur at my God!
line_2: " Meek let me bow before thy rod,

line_1: " Where Mercy's beams surround thy Throne.
line_2: " For a Soul dearer than my own.

line_1: " For a Soul dearer than my own.
line_2: " Where Mercy's beams surround thy Throne.

line_1: " The strength to guide my voice aright;
line_2: " O! take this Phantom from my sight.

line_1: " O! take this Phantom from my sight.
line_2: " The strength to guide my voice aright;

line_1: " Against my soul thy wrath doth move;
line_2: " And not in her I maddening love.

line_1: " And not in her I maddening love.
line_2: " Against my soul thy wrath doth move;

line_1: " I feel the torture phrenzy knows,
line_2: " Yet add to mine, her sum of woes!

line_1: " Yet add to mine, her sum of woes!
line_2: " I feel the torture phrenzy knows,

line_1: " Fall aught of ill, oh! be it mine!
line_2: " Still let thy Grace around her shine.

line_1: " Still let thy Grace around her shine.
line_2: " Fall aught of ill, oh! be it mine!

line_1: " Let peace, and glory, crown her head.
line_2: " And but for me, one tear be shed.

line_1: " And but for me, one tear be shed.
line_2: " Let peace, and glory, crown her head.

line_1: " Which sadly-pleasing moves the heart;
line_2: " Is seen from Passion's eye to start.

line_1: " Is seen from Passion's eye to start.
line_2: " Which sadly-pleasing moves the heart;

line_1: " Late may she learn my hapless doom.
line_2: " Grant us! — vain wish, — one common tomb!

line_1: " Grant us! — vain wish, — one common tomb!
line_2: " Late may she learn my hapless doom.

line_1: " Awful, Omnipotent, yet Just.
line_2: " Nor the worm, humbled to the dust.

line_1: " Nor the worm, humbled to the dust.
line_2: " Awful, Omnipotent, yet Just.

line_1: " Not to my errours be it join'd:
line_2: " And the frail weakness of my Mind.

line_1: " And the frail weakness of my Mind.
line_2: " Not to my errours be it join'd:

line_1: " A virtuous mind in beauty's form, —
line_2: " And on my head direct the storm.

line_1: " And on my head direct the storm.
line_2: " A virtuous mind in beauty's form, —

line_1: " Yet fearful is the scene it shows:
line_2: " O! add not madness to my woes.

line_1: " O! add not madness to my woes.
line_2: " Yet fearful is the scene it shows:

line_1: " The wreck of Man's pre-eminence:
line_2: " God! show thy blest Omnipotence. "

line_1: " God! show thy blest Omnipotence. "
line_2: " The wreck of Man's pre-eminence:

line_1: The Pilgrim said his wonted prayers,
line_2: With agonizing sighs and tears.

line_1: With agonizing sighs and tears.
line_2: The Pilgrim said his wonted prayers,

line_1: And view'd the workings of his soul,
line_2: Yet fear'd the storm, he would control.

line_1: Yet fear'd the storm, he would control.
line_2: And view'd the workings of his soul,

line_1: The young Monk spent night's live-long hours.
line_2: And show'd Religion's healing powers.

line_1: And show'd Religion's healing powers.
line_2: The young Monk spent night's live-long hours.

line_1: And in the East, no Sun appears.
line_2: Each leafless tree is dropping tears.

line_1: Each leafless tree is dropping tears.
line_2: And in the East, no Sun appears.

line_1: Now call'd the pious, hallow'd Priest;
line_2: Attended by his sorrowing Guest.

line_1: Attended by his sorrowing Guest.
line_2: Now call'd the pious, hallow'd Priest;

line_1: Fasting; to meditate, and pray.
line_2: Yet could not prayer his gloom allay.

line_1: Yet could not prayer his gloom allay.
line_2: Fasting; to meditate, and pray.

line_1: Hubert, sad Anselm, thus address'd,
line_2: " Or is thy soul too much distress'd?

line_1: " Or is thy soul too much distress'd?
line_2: Hubert, sad Anselm, thus address'd,

line_1: " Which nought on earth can e'er erase;
line_2: " And place them on the Altar's base,

line_1: SWEET Morn of Life! All hail, ye hours of ease!
line_2: When modest grace exerts each power to please,

line_1: When blooms the cheek with roseate, varying dyes;
line_2: And streaming lustre radiates in the eyes.

line_1: When modest grace exerts each power to please,
line_2: SWEET Morn of Life! All hail, ye hours of ease!

line_1: And streaming lustre radiates in the eyes.
line_2: When blooms the cheek with roseate, varying dyes;

line_1: Thy past hours, innocent; thy present, gay;
line_2: Thy future, halcyon Hope depicts without allay.

line_1: Thy future, halcyon Hope depicts without allay.
line_2: Thy past hours, innocent; thy present, gay;

line_1: Day-spring of Life! oh, stay thy fleeting hours!
line_2: Fancy, to cheer thy path, strews all her flowers,

line_1: Thou fairy-reign of ev'ry pleasant thought!
line_2: And in her loom thy plan of years is wrought.

line_1: Fancy, to cheer thy path, strews all her flowers,
line_2: Day-spring of Life! oh, stay thy fleeting hours!

line_1: And in her loom thy plan of years is wrought.
line_2: Thou fairy-reign of ev'ry pleasant thought!

line_1: By thee for goodness is each heart caress'd;
line_2: The World, untried, is judg'd by that within thy breast.

line_1: The World, untried, is judg'd by that within thy breast.

line_1: Sweet state of Youth! O harmony of Soul!
line_2: And evening comes serene, nor cares control;

line_2: And night approaches with soft, infant dreams.

line_1: Ah! be thou spent as Virtue bids to spend!
line_2: Then, — though we wish thy stay, — no sighs thy reign shall end.
